greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Square array A(n,k), n >= 0, k >= 0, read by antidiagonals, where column k is the expansion of the e.g.f. exp(-x)/(1 - k*x).
comment: For n > 0 and k > 0, A(n,k) gives the number of derangements of the generalized symmetric group S(k,n), which is the wreath product of Z_k by S_n. - _Peter Kagey_, Apr 07 2020
link: Alois P. Heinz, Antidiagonals n = 0..140, flattened
formula: E.g.f. of column k: exp(-x)/(1 - k*x).
maple: seq(seq(A(n, d-n), n=0..d), d=0..12);  # _Alois P. Heinz_, May 07 2020
mathematica: Table[Function[k, n! SeriesCoefficient[Exp[-x]/(1 - k x), {x, 0, n}]][j - n], {j, 0, 10}, {n, 0, j}] // Flatten
Table[Function[k, (-1)^n HypergeometricPFQ[{1, -n}, {}, k]][j - n], {j, 0, 10}, {n, 0, j}] // Flatten
results.author: _Ilya Gutkovskiy_, Oct 03 2018
